#Text=Pakistan 's National Assembly passes bill to merge Federally Administered Tribal
#Text=Areas with Khyber Pakhtunkhwa
#Text=Sunday , May 27 , 2018

#Text=On Thursday , Pakistan ' s lower house of parliament , the National Assembly , voted in favour of merging the country 's Federally Administered Tribal Areas ( FATA ) with the neighbouring province of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa ( KP ) .
#Text=The bill , subject to approval by the Senate , the KP assembly , and the president , would ensure FATA is governed by the federal as well as the provincial government .
#Text=The Senate passed the bill on Friday by a two-thirds majority , with 71 voting in favour and five opposing the merger .
#Text=The bill was passed by a 229 to 1 majority by the 342-member National Assembly in Islamabad .
#Text=Prime Minister Shahid Khaqan Abbasi thanked the opposition parties for their support .
#Text=The Pashtunkhwa Milli Awami Party and Jamiat Ulema-e Islam ( F ) ( JUI-F ) were the only two parties to oppose the merger .
#Text=Opposition leader Imran Khan of the Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf ( PTI ) political party said , " The tribal people want immediate justice just like the system that we have in KP " .
#Text=Since Pakistan 's 1947 independence from British rule , FATA has been governed by " Political Agents " appointed by the Pakistani President .
#Text=These agents exercise near-complete autonomous control over the area .
#Text=About five million people live in the seven districts — Bajaur , Khyber , Kurram , Mohmand , Orakzai as well as North and South Waziristan — which constitute FATA .
#Text=Political agents are responsible for providing governmental services and judiciary under Article 247 of the Pakistani Constitution .
#Text=Before January 12 , when a bill extended to FATA the writ of the Pakistani Supreme Court and Peshawar High Court , the tribal area was out of the jurisdiction of the Pakistani courts .
#Text=Collective punishment of a tribe can be declared under the Frontier Crimes Regulations , the code applicable to the seven districts .
#Text=Per the rules dating back to the colonial era , FATA citizens do not enjoy all the rights under the Constitution of Pakistan that other Pakistanis are entitled to .
#Text=Prime Minister Abbasi said , " This is the start of a process , not the end of one .

#Text=He later added ,  We have to give the people of FATA the same schools , the same colleges , the same universities , the same hospitals , the same roads and the system as is available to everyone else in Pakistan .

#Text=party leader Dr Farooq Sattar called for a referendum to make FATA a separate province and explained their support for the current bill as  for the sake of political unity " .

column1: #Text=" We fear that if Fata is merged with KP , it will get difficult to create a new province in the future " , Sattar commented .
#Text=Calling it a " black day " , JUI-F 's representative Jamaluddin said the parties had voted to " usurp the rights of the people of Fata " .
#Text=Prime Minister Shahid Khaqan Abbasi said , " Today this house has approved a historic bill , which will have very positive effects for Pakistan .
